meanings.definition: To retract or take back a promise or oath.
meanings.sent1: She regretted unswearing her vow to always help others.
meanings.sent2: He unswore his allegiance to the king when he discovered the truth.
meanings.sent3: The magician unswearing his spell accidentally turned himself into a frog.
meanings.sent4: After unswearing his promise, it felt like a weight had been lifted off his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The teacher unswearing the assignment deadline brought relief to the stressed students.

meanings.definition: The act of renouncing or denying a previous statement or commitment.
meanings.sent1: Her unswearing of the agreement surprised everyone in the room.
meanings.sent2: The unswearing of his confession raised doubts about his honesty.
meanings.sent3: The politician's unswearing of his support for the bill caused chaos in the parliament.
meanings.sent4: The sudden unswearing of the contract left the company in a difficult position.
meanings.sent5: The public unswearing of the celebrity's apology sparked controversy on social media.
